SEARCH
Package interfaces

Interface DateAndTime

All Known Implementing Classes:
AppointmentHandler, Doctor
public interface DateAndTime
Interface that provides utility methods for validating date and time formats and ranges. These methods check the validity of time, date, and the two time(start and end time).

  • Method Summary

    Static Methods
    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    static boolean
    dateChecker(String date)
    Checks if the provided date is valid and if it represents a date after the current date.
    static boolean
    timeChecker(String time)
    Checks if the provided time is valid according to the "HH:mm" format.
    static boolean
    timeChecker(String startTime, String endTime)
    Checks if the provided start and end time are valid and if the end time is after the start time.
    static boolean
    timeOfDay(String time)
    Checks if the provided time matches a valid time-of-day format ("HH:mm").

  • Method Details

    • timeChecker

      static boolean timeChecker(String time)
      Checks if the provided time is valid according to the "HH:mm" format.
      Parameters:
      time - the time string to be checked
      Returns:
      true if the time is valid, false otherwise

    • timeChecker

      static boolean timeChecker(String startTime, String endTime)
      Checks if the provided start and end time are valid and if the end time is after the start time.
      Parameters:
      startTime - the start time string in "HH:mm" format
      endTime - the end time string in "HH:mm" format
      Returns:
      true if the times are valid and the end time is after the start time, false otherwise

    • dateChecker

      static boolean dateChecker(String date)
      Checks if the provided date is valid and if it represents a date after the current date.
      Parameters:
      date - the date string to be checked, in "dd/MM/yyyy" format
      Returns:
      true if the date is valid and is in the future, false otherwise

    • timeOfDay

      static boolean timeOfDay(String time)
      Checks if the provided time matches a valid time-of-day format ("HH:mm").
      Parameters:
      time - the time to be checked
      Returns:
      true if the time string matches the valid format, false otherwise
